text: Ever have one of those days where 'Data Science'  and 'ML' feel like just one big meme (e.g. people expect ML to be magic) :slightly_smiling_face: ?

elements.text: Ever have one of those days where 'Data Science'  and 'ML' feel like just one big meme (e.g. people expect ML to be magic)

text: It's not the acronym for “Magic Learning”? :grimacing: (sorry, it's been a long day)

elements.text: It's not the acronym for “Magic Learning”?

text: I would not be surprised if the ML hype dies sometime this decade because of teams 'underperforming'  (i.e. why no magic :disappointed: ) in investor/managements eyes

elements.text: I would not be surprised if the ML hype dies sometime this decade because of teams 'underperforming'  (i.e. why no magic

text: Oh man, I kind of hope so...

elements.text: Oh man, I kind of hope so...

text: I was pretty much asked "please use ML to find something interesting in the data" "erm... okay, but what do you mean by 'interesting'?" "ML should tell you that as well no?"

elements.text: I was pretty much asked "please use ML to find something interesting in the data" "erm... okay, but what do you mean by 'interesting'?" "ML should tell you that as well no?"

text: almost every ML job I've had has suffered from "it's not magic?" and then upper management thinking I'm lying to them that AI isn't solved

elements.text: almost every ML job I've had has suffered from "it's not magic?" and then upper management thinking I'm lying to them that AI isn't solved

text: "yea can't you just use an AI and solve this?" "Let me explain to you that if that were possible physics as a field would not exist"

elements.text: "yea can't you just use an AI and solve this?" "Let me explain to you that if that were possible physics as a field would not exist"

text: Strongly considering my next role being either a software engineer, professor, or consultant. Maybe in 5-10 years my field will be less basterdized and I can do it again
